Package com.pandora.config.reactions.abstractions

Class Reaction

java.lang.Object
com.pandora.config.reactions.abstractions.Reaction
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReactionConfiguration
Direct Known Subclasses:
Oxidation
public abstract class Reaction extends Object implements ReactionConfiguration
The Reaction class represents an abstract implementation of the ReactionConfiguration interface, providing common functionality for configuring biogeochemical reactions in freshwater systems.

This class includes fields for accessing the Spring framework's environment and a service for managing Specie beans. It also initializes maps to store species produced and removed by the reaction, along with their corresponding quantities. Developers can extend this class to implement specific reaction configurations.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Wim Joost van Hoek

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      @PostConstruct public void initialize()
      Initializes the reaction configuration during the post-construction phase. This method is annotated with PostConstruct to ensure it is executed after the bean has been constructed, allowing for any necessary setup steps.

      Developers extending the Reaction class can override this method to perform custom initialization tasks specific to their reaction implementations. The method is invoked automatically after the bean is constructed, providing an opportunity to set up initial conditions or configurations.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface ReactionConfiguration
      See Also:
      • PostConstruct
      • Reaction

    • getProducedSpecies

      public final Map<Specie,Integer> getProducedSpecies()

    • calculate

      public final double[] calculate(double[] y)
      Description copied from interface: ReactionConfiguration
      Calculates the changes in species concentrations based on the provided array of concentrations.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface ReactionConfiguration
      Parameters:
      y - An array representing the concentrations of chemical species involved in the reaction.
      Returns:
      An array representing the changes in concentrations for each chemical species.

    • getReactionProductionPrefix

      protected abstract String getReactionProductionPrefix()
      Retrieves the prefix used to construct property names for species production values associated with this reaction. Subclasses should implement this method to provide the specific prefix used in dynamically retrieving configuration values related to the production of species during the reaction.
      Returns:
      A String representing the prefix for production property names.
      See Also:
      • Reaction

    • getReactionRemovalPrefix

      protected abstract String getReactionRemovalPrefix()
      Retrieves the prefix used to construct property names for species removal values associated with this reaction. Subclasses should implement this method to provide the specific prefix used in dynamically retrieving configuration values related to the removal of species during the reaction.
      Returns:
      A String representing the prefix for removal property names.
      See Also:
      • Reaction

    • getRate

      protected abstract double getRate(double[] y)
      Calculates and returns the rate of the reaction based on the current state of the system, represented by the array y containing concentrations of different species. Subclasses should implement this method to define the reaction kinetics specific to their reaction type.
      Parameters:
      y - The array representing the concentrations of different species in the system.
      Returns:
      The rate of the reaction.
      See Also:
      • Reaction
